net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class ProcessExecutors

  • Object
    • ProcessExecutors

  • public class ProcessExecutors
extends Object
    A class for convenience and factory methods for creating instances of implementations of the ProcessExecutorService interface.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Method Detail

      • newCustomProcessPool

        public static ProcessExecutorService newCustomProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory managerFactory,
                                                          int minPoolSize,
                                                          int maxPoolSize,
                                                          int reserveSize)
                                                   throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of processes. The initial size of the pool is the greater of the minimum pool size and the reserve size. This method blocks until the initial number of processes started up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions. It is a convenience method for the constructor ProcessPoolExecutor.ProcessPoolExecutor(ProcessManagerFactory, int, int, int, boolean) with verbose set to false.
        Parameters:
        managerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        Returns:
        A pool of process executors each hosting a process.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the processes to start up.

      • newFixedProcessPool

        public static ProcessExecutorService newFixedProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory managerFactory,
                                                         int size)
                                                  throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of a fixed number of processes. It is a convenience method for calling newCustomProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory, int, int, int) with minPoolSize and maxPoolSize equal and a reserveSize of 0. The number of executors in the pool is always kept at the specified value.
        Parameters:
        managerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        size - The number of processes to maintain in the pool.
        Returns:
        A fixed size pool of process executors.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the processes to start up.

      • newCachedProcessPool

        public static ProcessExecutorService newCachedProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory managerFactory)
                                                   throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of processes that grows in size as required. It is a convenience method for calling newCustomProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory, int, int, int) with 0 as the minPoolSize and the reserveSize, and Integer.MAX_VALUE as the maximum pool size.
        Parameters:
        managerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        Returns:
        An unbounded pool of process executors.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the processes to start up.

      • newSingleProcessPool

        public static ProcessExecutorService newSingleProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory managerFactory)
                                                   throws InterruptedException
        Returns a fixed size pool holding a single process. It is a convenience method for calling the method newFixedProcessPool(ProcessManagerFactory, int) with size set to 1.
        Parameters:
        managerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        Returns:
        A pool holding a single process executor.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the processes to start up.

      • newCustomJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newCustomJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions options,
                                                                  int minPoolSize,
                                                                  int maxPoolSize,
                                                                  int reserveSize)
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a custom process pool using Java processes. The initial size of the pool is the greater of the minimum pool size and the reserve size. This method blocks until the initial number of processes started up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions. It is a convenience method for the constructor JavaProcessPoolExecutor.JavaProcessPoolExecutor(JavaProcessOptions, int, int, int, Runnable, boolean) with startupTask set to null and verbose set to false.
        Parameters:
        options - The options for the "java" program used to create the new JVM.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        Returns:
        A custom pool of Java processes.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the manager factory is null, or the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

      • newCustomJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newCustomJavaProcessPool(int minPoolSize,
                                                                  int maxPoolSize,
                                                                  int reserveSize)
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a custom process pool using Java processes. The initial size of the pool is the greater of the minimum pool size and the reserve size. This method blocks until the initial number of processes started up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions. It is a convenience method for newCustomJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions, int, int, int) with options set to null.
        Parameters:
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        Returns:
        A custom pool of Java processes.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

      • newFixedJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newFixedJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions options,
                                                                 int size)
                                                          throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of a fixed number of Java processes. It is a convenience method for calling newCustomJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions, int, int, int) with minPoolSize and maxPoolSize set to the value of size and reserveSize set to 0. The number of executors in the pool is always kept at the specified value.
        Parameters:
        options - The options for the "java" program used to create the new JVM.
        size - The number of processes to maintain in the pool.
        Returns:
        A fixed-sized pool of Java processes.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.

      • newFixedJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newFixedJavaProcessPool(int size)
                                                          throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of a fixed number of Java processes. It is a convenience method for calling newFixedJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions, int) with options set to null. The number of executors in the pool is always kept at the specified value.
        Parameters:
        size - The number of processes to maintain in the pool.
        Returns:
        A fixed-sized pool of Java processes.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.

      • newCachedJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newCachedJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions options)
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of Java processes that grows in size as required.. It is a convenience method for calling newCustomJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions, int, int, int) with minPoolSize set to 0, maxPoolSize set to Integer.MAX_VALUE and reserveSize set to 0.
        Parameters:
        options - The options for the "java" program used to create the new JVM.
        Returns:
        A pool of Java processes that grows in size as required.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.

      • newCachedJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newCachedJavaProcessPool()
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a pool of Java processes that grows in size as required.. It is a convenience method for calling newCachedJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions) with options set to null.
        Returns:
        A pool of Java processes that grows in size as required.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.

      • newSingleJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newSingleJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions options)
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a fixed size pool holding a single Java process. It is a convenience method for calling the method newFixedJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions, int) with size set to 1.
        Parameters:
        options - The options for the "java" program used to create the new JVM.
        Returns:
        A pool maintaining a single Java process executor.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.

      • newSingleJavaProcessPool

        public static JavaProcessExecutorService newSingleJavaProcessPool()
                                                           throws InterruptedException
        Returns a fixed size pool holding a single Java process. It is a convenience method for calling the method newSingleJavaProcessPool(JavaProcessOptions) with options set to null.
        Returns:
        A pool maintaining a single Java process executor.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
